docs.snippet: Facebook's CEO apologized for the Cambridge Analytica scandal with ads in multiple U.S. and British newspapers Sunday, saying the social media platform doesn't deserve to hold personal information if it can't protect it.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Ads Apologize for Cambridge Analytica Scandal
headline.main: Facebook Ads Apologize for Cambridge Analytica Scandal

docs.snippet: Oregon's attorney general says she is reviewing whether to launch an investigation of Facebook, including whether it violated a state law that protects online customers' private information.

headline.print_headline: Oregon Attorney General Considers Investigating Facebook
headline.main: Oregon Attorney General Considers Investigating Facebook

docs.snippet: Israel is investigating Facebook Inc. over possible infringement of its citizens' privacy following reports that British consultancy Cambridge Analytica improperly accessed users' information, the Justice Ministry said on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: Israel Investigating Facebook Over Privacy Concerns
headline.main: Israel Investigating Facebook Over Privacy Concerns
